label: TOPO2
description:
Thessa Torsing​ aka Upsammy plays to her most sanguine side on a suite of finely pruned and immersive synth environments glistening with the pharmaceutically affective touch that has defined her works for PAN, Die Orakel and Dekmantel.

Equally known as a dance-starter and composer of filigree melodic delicacies, Upsammy has, over the past five years, emerged among Europe’s leading proponents of electronica in that vein of interest that reaches back thru Aleksi Perälä’s colundi... more

title_full:
Suzanne Ciani

              —
              Seven Waves
            
              (Finders Keepers Records)
label: Finders Keepers Records
description:
Three decades since it was pressed (and sold over 100,000 copies), the sonic sisterhood of Bird Records present a lavish and timely reissue of Suzanne Ciani's oneiric debut album.

We'll let the "Delia Derbyshire of the Atari generation" elucidate: "Originally released exactly 30 years ago, Seven Waves was my first commercial album. It took two years to complete and was first released in Japan in 1982. Seven Waves is special for me because it expresses my love for and fascination with early... more

label: raster-noton / NOTON
description:
Xerrox Vol.1 is the first of five in an intended series and is based on the concept of copying. Together with Christoph Brünggel, Nicolai designed a 'sample transformer' which would take audio fragments and manipulate them beyond recognition, taking something familiar and de-familiarising it. The result is perhaps the definitive Alva Noto album and one of the most sublime releases in Carsten Nicolai's weighty catalogue.

Samples were taken from the most obvious sources; advertising jingles... more

title_full:
Various

            —
            12 Hours of Brown Noise Sleep (Spotify Playlist)

label: Ilian Tape
description:
Skee Mask lays out his towel at dawn in ‘Resort’ for a sun-dazed transition between baked ambient, effusive breakbeats, and braindance-type electronica with fellow Münchners Ilian Tape.

The cult German producer, beloved of both IDM diehards and a new wave of ravers, places tactful and precise studio tekkerz at the service of his lushest sentiments here. It’s his first album, proper, since 2021’s ‘Pool’ (not counting a trio of digital self-releases) and likewise takes the longform canvas as... more
